sect3.title: Configuration Information

userinput.command: echo `hostname` > /etc/mail/local-host-names cat > /etc/mail/aliases << "EOF" postmaster: root MAILER-DAEMON: root EOF cp -R cf/* /etc/mail && cp cf/cf/{submit,sendmail}.mc /etc/mail && newaliases -v

sect3.para: To start and stop Sendmail on system boot/shutdown create the sendmail boot script with the following commands:

note.para: The -qNm option, where N is number of minutes, controls how often Sendmail will process the mail queue. A default of 5 minutes is used here. Individual workstation users may want to set this as low as 1 minute, large installations handling more mail will want to set it higher.

sect3.para: Create the run level symlinks with the following commands:

userinput.command: cd /etc/rc.d/init.d && ln -sf ../init.d/sendmail ../rc0.d/K25sendmail && ln -sf ../init.d/sendmail ../rc1.d/K25sendmail && ln -sf ../init.d/sendmail ../rc2.d/K25sendmail && ln -sf ../init.d/sendmail ../rc3.d/S35sendmail && ln -sf ../init.d/sendmail ../rc4.d/S35sendmail && ln -sf ../init.d/sendmail ../rc5.d/S35sendmail && ln -sf ../init.d/sendmail ../rc6.d/K25sendmail
